trustfund:
TF056536-PHRD-MONGOLIA: INFORMATION AND
            COMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMEN

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Information and
            Communications Infrastructure Development Project for
            Mongolia were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk
            to development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: the Communications Regulation
            Commission (CRC) implementation of the Global Partnership on
            Output-Based Aid (GPOBA) pilots helped the client learn from
            market approaches to universal access, and also familiarized
            them with World Bank procurement and financial management
            procedures. This allowed for the successful and timely
            completion of the rural access component. The client ensured
            that it consulted widely with private sector in order to
            gauge both their interest and design a practical approach to
            providing access in rural areas. The project proved that
            there is significant untapped demand for mobile services in
            rural areas. Beneficiary agencies and target services should
            be identified prior to project inception. If e-Government
            public private partnerships (PPPs) are to be prioritized,
            either: (a) adapted standard bidding documents should be
            produced, or (b) the bidding approach should be identified
            during project design and work on the contractual aspects of
            the bidding documents should begin at project inception.
            Until the political environment in Mongolia matures, it will
            be preferable to avoid scheduling system procurements which
            span more than one election cycle. Despite change in
            government and leadership at the implementation agencies,
            the project implementation unit (PIU) was a constant that
            helped keep the project on track.
